description.narrative: The project entails constructing a methodology for a self-induced decolonisation process of the Miskito indigenous territories of Twi Waupasa, Twi Yahbra ja Wangki Twi on Northern Atlantic Autonomous Region of Nicaragua, strengthening the administrative an d territorial governance capacity of the implementing organisations AMICA and YATAMA, and production of websites for them. The decolonization process aims to resolve the fate of the non-indigenous population of the indigenous territories and halt further i mmigration in order to materialize the indigenous peoples? legal right to govern their territories, protect their natural resources and improve the indigenous peoples? quality of life. The project is part of a process implemented by the legal and recognize d Miskito leadership (the territorial governments and YATAMA as people?s movement) in favour of their communities. The indigenous peoples of the Nicaraguan Atlantic Coast have historically been marginalized in relation to the dominant population of the Pac ific Coast. The law on the governance of the indigenous territories of the Atlantic Coast, particularly its decolonization clause, has not been implemented. The national government?s input for the welfare of the area is minimal in comparison to the exploit ation of its natural resources. Most of the 21 indigenous territories of the Coast suffer severe impacts of immigrant invasion, particularly logging of forests for cattle ranching.
